TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit ChannelManagerService extends System.Workflow.Runtime.Hosting.WorkflowRuntimeService

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("The System.Workflow.* types are deprecated. Instead, please use the new types from System.Activities.*")

Docs.summary: Provides functionality for constructing client-side channels, caching channels, and channel factories.

remarks.format:
## Remarks
> [!NOTE] > [!INCLUDE[DeprecatedContent](~/includes/deprecatedcontent-md.md)]
The <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Hosting.ChannelManagerService> is responsible for creating a channel for a <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.SendActivity> based on the channel token defined in the activity's <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.SendActivity.ChannelToken%2A>.

[!code-csharp[ChannelManagerService#0](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/channelmanagerservice/cs/snippets.cs#0)] [!code-vb[ChannelManagerService#0](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CFX/channelmanagerservice/vb/snippets.vb#0)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Collections.Generic.IList`1<class System.ServiceModel.Description.ServiceEndpoint> endpoints) cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Instances of the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Hosting.ChannelManagerService> class are usually created by the runtime using configuration files.
The endpoints defined in the service's constructor will be used to create channels that match the configuration name in the <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.SendActivity.ChannelToken%2A>. The endpoints defined in the configuration take precedence over the endpoints defined in code, so if a service endpoint added through code has the same name and contract type as one in the configuration file, then the endpoint defined in code will not be used.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to create a new instance of the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Hosting.ChannelManagerService> object. This example was adapted from the `WorkflowServiceUtility` SDK sample.
[!code-csharp[ChannelManagerService#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_CFX/channelmanagerservice/cs/snippets.cs#1)] [!code-vb[ChannelManagerService#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_CFX/channelmanagerservice/vb/snippets.vb#1)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor(class System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection parameters) cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The following parameters are supported:
- `idleTimeout`: The maximum <xref:System.TimeSpan> that a cached channel can be idle.
- `leaseTimeout`: The maximum <xref:System.TimeSpan> that a cached channel can be checked out or in use by a <xref:System.Workflow.Activities.SendActivity>.
- `maxIdleChannelsPerEndpoint`: The maximum number of idle channels matching a single endpoint that can be cached at any point.
Instances of the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Hosting.ChannelManagerService> class are usually created by the runtime using configuration files.
## Examples The following example demonstrates how to create a new instance of the <xref:System.Workflow.Runtime.Hosting.ChannelManagerService> object.
